channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Trump urges Iranians to keep protesting, says 'help is on its way'
item.description: US President Donald Trump urged Iranians on Tuesday to keep protesting and said help was on the way, without giving details, as Iran's clerical establishment pressed its crackdown against the biggest demonstrations in years. "Iranian Patriots, KEEP PROTESTING - TAKE OVER YOUR INSTITUTIONS!!!... HE

item.title: Arbeloa vows to ‘fight for everything’ as Real Madrid manager
item.description: Real Madrid’s new manager Alvaro Arbeloa pledged to fight for everything as he stepped into the role vacated by Xabi Alonso and said he would stay in post as long as he was needed. Real announced Alonso had left the club by mutual agreement on Monday, following a poor run of form and reports

item.title: UN rights office says hundreds killed in Iran protests
item.description: The UN human rights chief said on Tuesday that he was "horrified" by mounting violence by Iran's security forces against peaceful protesters, with the UN citing its own sources as saying that hundreds have been killed so far. The Islamic Republic's clerical authorities are facing the biggest demon

item.title: The BBC seeks to dismiss Trump’s $10b defamation lawsuit in a Florida court
item.description: The BBC plans to ask a court to throw out U.S. President Donald Trump’s $10 billion lawsuit against the British broadcaster, court papers show. Trump filed a lawsuit in December over the way the BBC edited a speech he gave on Jan. 6, 2021. The claim, filed in a Florida federal court, seeks $
